meanings.definition: Pontifices: plural form of pontifex, a high priest in ancient Rome
meanings.sent1: In ancient Rome, the pontifices were respected high priests.
meanings.sent2: The pontifices performed important religious ceremonies in Rome.
meanings.sent3: The pontifices decided to have a feast in honor of the gods.
meanings.sent4: The pontifices' wisdom shone like a beacon in the city.
meanings.sent5: The colorful robes of the pontifices fluttered in the breeze.

meanings.definition: Pontifices: members of the College of Pontiffs in ancient Rome
meanings.sent1: The College of Pontiffs included knowledgeable pontifices.
meanings.sent2: Pontifices in the College of Pontiffs were responsible for religious matters.
meanings.sent3: The pontifices in the College of Pontiffs organized a grand procession.
meanings.sent4: Among the College of Pontiffs, the pontifices were like guiding stars.
meanings.sent5: The pontifices' chants echoed through the halls of the College.
